instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.18A
threads.message:
There was 5V and 0.01A
Board had tiny liquid damage on <CHIP>U8220</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C8220</CAPACITOR>.
Both components replaced and board only had 20V and 0.15A.
With battery connected it was at only 5V.

Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> now got 20V with battery at around 1.2A

Board only got 20V 0.18A.
N0 chime, no caps lock light, USB activity OK.

Board only:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13.01V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4V
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.31V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.31V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.11V


On thermal camera <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> gets around 60C-70C and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> 50C.

Any idea where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.18A
threads.message:
"USB activity OK"
Are you sure?
Don't confuse between power and activity.

What is CPU core voltage after 10s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.18A
threads.message:
Sorry, it was USB power.

<SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> after 15 secondesdrop from to 0.962V to 0.644V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.18A
threads.message:
Looks like board boots.
Still no Caps Lock reaction?
Just in case, try PRAM reset and check USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.18A
